Header: Signals Conducts Training Session for OUSL Security Staff
Content: Sri Lanka Signal Corps (SLSC) conducted a specially-designed training session on ‘Social Etiquettes and Working Place Courtesy’ for members of the Security Staff at the Open University of Sri Lanka (OUSL) on Wednesday (3) at the OUSL Staff Development Centre in Nawala. The request to this effect has been made to the Commander of the Army by the OUSL. The training session, designed under the close supervision of the Colonel Commandant of Sri Lanka Signal Corps was conducted by Lieutenant Colonel N.P.A Mendis of the SLSC. All members of the permanent Security Staff and the Chief Security Officer at the OUSL actively participated in the programme.
